channel.title: Dependency Inversion Principle on Kamran Sadin - Kevin

item.title: SOLID - Dependency Inversion Principle
item.description: The Interface Segregation Principle advocates that clients should not be forced to depend on interfaces they do not use. In other words, a class should not be forced to implement methods it does not need. Instead of a monolithic interface, classes should have smaller, specific interfaces tailored to their requirements.
